lexUnit.name: decent.a
lexUnit.definition: COD: conforming with generally accepted standards of morality or respectability

sentence.text: Come to think of it , he 'd seemed rather a decent chap , someone it might be worth getting to know .
So powerful had these embattled minorities become , that decent chaps like him had been forced upon the defensive .
Their subtext was that this was a devoted husband and a decent chap , not the apprentice dictator that his detractors portrayed .
Most Kingsmarkham faces were familiar to Wexford and Burden remembered seeing him the night before arm-in-arm with the dead man , singing and disturbing decent citizens .
He 's in one of those Victorian institutions that were built out in the countryside so the inmates would n't contaminate decent citizens .
` In my book , that 's the sort of response to be expected of an honest , decent , upright citizen . "
` Good , decent , hard-working men , dedicated to their tough industry , face financial ruin , " she said .
According to them , he was sassy , sharp , matalino ; a fundamentally decent man undone by a scheming and treacherous woman .
And of those tens of thousands the overwhelming number were decent , god-fearing men and women .
Unsuspecting , and being a decent , trusting sort of man , I foolishly agreed to tag along and help .
The rector and one or two other neighbours had called upon him already and pronounced him ` a very nice man " or ` a decent sort of fellow " according to sex .
He 's a decent sort of man -- Howard knows his type well from his stay in the country .
He was giving palpitations to perfectly decent women , by lurking like this .
" Goodbye , " said this kindly decent woman , her distress at the ways of this wicked world written all over her .
` It should be recorded that whatever her failings disclosed by the evidence in this trial , she deserves to be remembered as a vivacious , caring and decent young woman . "
If Charles chose to throw an opportunity away , that was no reason to throw every scrap of decent behaviour away too .
The dissonance between the act of firing someone and the manager 's beliefs about what is acceptable or decent behaviour from one individual to another can be extremely painful .
Generally the reader wants his narrator to be upright , decent , honest , and not prone to the lusts that plague other people -- never ourselves .
Nothing really extraordinary happens , and most of the young people are very decent and honest .
He would be truthful , decent and honest , like the advertisements .
You 'll like the village , I 'm sure , and there are some awfully decent people scattered about .
He may be safely out of the way again now , but a lot of decent people have no safety and no homes . "
I do n't see why decent ordinary people having a night out should suffer for the actions of a few . "
It is hardly decent to envy the baby to whom so much is owed .
Most of us were peaceful and decent , but here we go again , in our fifth war of this century .
GEORGE Bush is the most decent , most caring , wisest and , yes , healthiest man I know .
` But it 's not decent to go to war over something like this , " I screamed , thumping my fist on the table so that the cups on the dresser rattled .
He 's too decent to blame you .
` He was n't exactly a winner but he was honest and decent in every way .
